feed.title: Category: picks | User group for Viennese rubyists

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
12/31 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eighty-seventh edition:

Laura:
  • Advanced Rake - Learn Advanced Rake in 7 Episodes
  • Deoptimizing Ruby - bonus: with pretty Alice in Wonderland illustrations
  • Hack the rainforest - An amazing project to help document environmental and human rights abuses
Floor:
  • RDI - Repository Driven Infrastructure, a term coined by our friends at Codeship. Interesting article.
  • Internet map - Love this. via Sebastian
  • 31c3 recordings - I know what I’ll be doing this weekend…

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
12/24 Picks, Merry Christmas everybody!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eighty-sixth edition:

Laura:
  • Ferry - a command-line tool for data migrations and manipulation by the students of Carnegie Mellon
  • Starburst - In-app announcements to users in your Rails app
Ben:
  • Bad, bad, bad - Bad code isn’t Technical Debt, it’s an unhedged Call Option
  • Papers, please - 10 Technical Papers Every Programmer Should Read (At Least Twice)
Floor:
  • active_emoji - Erik created a collection of emoji aliases for core Ruby methods. Got to love this.
  • Evil Icons - … a simple and clean SVG icon pack with the code to support Rails, Sinatra and Node.js.
  • tic-tac-toe - play tic-tac-toe in your Terminal. Because you can.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
12/17 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eighty-fifth edition:

Laura:
  • Storytime - A Rails-4 CMS and blogging engine, with a core focus on content
  • Raffler - Raffle meetup.com event attendees! An app built by our friends from the Slovenia Ruby User Group
Floor:
  • RubyConf 2014 - The video’s from RubyConf San Diego are online. I know what I’ll be doing this weekend…
  • Ten Years of Ruby Conferences - Jeremy Flores & Carol Nichols created a ‘dramatic revue’ of 10 years of Ruby conferences for Keep Ruby Weird. And it’s good.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
12/10 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eighty-fourth edition:

Laura:
  • 24 Pull Requests - Giving back little gifts of code for Christmas
  • Uncss - Remove all those unused styles from your css!
  • Regex Crosswords - Show off those Regex skills you got
Floor:
  • Rails Girls Brno - they shot this video during their November edition and it’s <3
  • BentoBox app - Nur Sah Ketene made this super useful resource for future Rails Girls workshops (or generally beginner workshops)
  • Foodhack Vienna - Aaron Cruz already introduced it during our last meetup: you can now help Austria eliminate food waste

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
12/03 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eighty-third edition:

Laura:
  • CLI GitHub - A fancy GitHub client for command line
  • Dokku - Your own mini-Heroku, in under five minutes
Floor:
  • CSS3 animation cheat sheet - a great set of preset, plug-and-play animations for your web projects.
  • git extras - adding more git utilities to your toolbelt
